title: Two unknown book typefaces
content:
Hello,

I’ve been looking around for a few days trying to identify these two typefaces. Just thought I would check here in case someone has seen these before.

This first sample is from a book titled Fransche Kunst, printed 1918

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080929203112im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/option01-a-c1_6227.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080929203112im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/option01-a-c2_5598.jpg)

——

This second typeface is from the book Mensch en Natuur, 1913.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080929203112im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/option02-a-c1_4989.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080929203112im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/option02-a-c2_5246.jpg)

 [‹ I need a sans serif - bold and squarish, like facebook or eachday](http://web.archive.org/web/20080929203112/http:/www.typophile.com/node/49847 "Go to previous forum topic") [FONT ID ?? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080929203112/http:/www.typophile.com/node/49843 "Go to next forum topic")
author: abi

comments.content: ah, after a bit more looking around I spotted the first sample, it is Salisbury (albeit slightly condensed) from R.H. Stevens & Co. London.
